page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: {TRANSPORT IN MOBBERLEY. {RAILWAYS. Mobberley station was built in 1862 when Cheshire Lines Railways extended from Altrincham to Northwich. Previously Wilmslow station was used by travellers to Manchester. B.R. employs three men at the station, working in shifts in the old fashioned signal box. Trains operate between Manchester Oxford Road and Chester General. 110 - 120 trains pass through daily, mainly freight, chemicals, oil/petroleum and limestone. No passenger service from Mobberley on Sundays. On week_days 22 2nd class trains stop on way to Manchester and 20 on Saturdays. Going south 22 trains stop on weekdays and 17 on saturdays. Steam trains pass through occasionally
